title: useLiteralKeys
description: |
  Enforce the usage of a literal access to properties over computed property access.
---
import { Tabs, TabItem } from '@astrojs/starlight/components';

**Diagnostic Category: `lint/complexity/useLiteralKeys`**
<Tabs>
<TabItem label="JavaScript (and super languages)" icon="seti:javascript">
**Since**: `v1.0.0`
:::note
- This rule is recommended by Biome. A diagnostic error will appear when linting your code.
- This rule has an **unsafe** fix.
:::

Sources: 
- Same as: <a href="https://eslint.org/docs/latest/rules/dot-notation" target="_blank"><code>dot-notation</code></a>
- Same as: <a href="https://typescript-eslint.io/rules/dot-notation" target="_blank"><code>@typescript-eslint/dot-notation</code></a>

Enforce the usage of a literal access to properties over computed property access.

## Examples

### Invalid

```js
a.b["c"];
```

<pre class="language-text"><code class="language-text">code-block.js:1:5 <a href="https://biomejs.dev/linter/rules/use-literal-keys">lint/complexity/useLiteralKeys</a> <span style="color: #000; expression can be simplified without the use of a string literal.</span><br />  <br />  <strong><span style="color: Tomato;">&gt;</span></strong> <strong>1 │ </strong>a.b[&quot;c&quot;];<br />
```js
a.c[`d`]
```


### Valid

```js
a["c" + "d"];
a[d.c];
```
